basicHTMLTags.description: The <html> tag represents the root of an HTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element.
The <head> element contains meta-information about the HTML document, such as its title and links to stylesheets.
The <title> tag defines the title of the document, which appears in the browser's title bar or tab.
The <body> tag contains all the contents of an HTML document, such as text, images, and links.
basicHTMLTags.example:
Welcome to My Website

This is a paragraph of text on my webpage.

basicHTMLTags.description: These tags represent headings, with <h1> being the highest level (largest) and <h6> the lowest (smallest).

The

tag is used to define a paragraph of text.
The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, used to link from one page to another. The href attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.
The tag is used to embed an image in an HTML page. The src attribute specifies the path to the image, and the alt attribute provides alternative text for the image.
The <div> tag is a block-level container used to group elements together for styling or layout purposes.
basicHTMLTags.example:
Title

This is a paragraph inside a div.

basicHTMLTags.description: The <span> tag is an inline container used to group elements together without affecting the layout. It's commonly used for styling a portion of text.
The <ul> tag defines an unordered list, <ol> defines an ordered list, and <li> defines a list item.
These tags are used to create tables. <table> defines the table, <tr> defines a table row, <th> defines a table header, and <td> defines a table cell.
The <form> tag is used to create an HTML form for user input. It can contain elements like <input>, <textarea>, and <button>.
basicHTMLTags.example:
<form action="/submit" method="post">
  <label for="name">Name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="name" name="name">
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

basicHTMLTags.description: The <input> tag is used to create interactive controls in an HTML form. It can be used to create text fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, etc.
basicHTMLTags.example:
<input type="text" id="username" name="username">
<input type="checkbox" id="subscribe" name="subscribe" value="newsletter">

basicHTMLTags.description: The <button> tag is used to create a clickable button. It can contain text or images.
The <textarea> tag is used to create a multi-line text input control.
basicHTMLTags.example:
<textarea id="message" name="message" rows="4" cols="50">
  Your message here...
</textarea>

basicHTMLTags.description: The <link> tag is used to link to external resources, such as stylesheets.
The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as character set, author, and viewport settings.
The <script> tag is used to embed or reference JavaScript code in an HTML document.
The <style> tag is used to define internal CSS styles for an HTML document.

pageManagement.consistentHeadings: Use the same style for headings
